$SPY is about to trigger the Zweig Breadth Thrust indicator which basically means the market goes from ‚Äúno one is buying‚Äù to ‚Äúeveryone is buying‚Äù in a very short amount of time.

It almost never happens & when it does it usually marks the beginning of a real trend rather than a short bounce. Perfect example was the last time it triggered was near the April lows & that ended up being the start of a HUGE move higher.

Every single instance going back to the 1950s has led to higher S&P levels one year later.

If the Thanksgiving conversation five years ago was that AI was about to change the world then these are the names that ended up proving it.

‚Ä¢ $NVDA +1,259%
‚Ä¢ $AVGO +907%
‚Ä¢ $PLTR +501%
‚Ä¢ $GOOGL +258%
‚Ä¢ $CRWD +233%
‚Ä¢ $TSM +194%
‚Ä¢ $NET +164%
‚Ä¢ $AMD +146%
$GOOGL CEO basically just said quantum is entering the same acceleration curve AI hit five years ago.
PENTAGON SAYS $BABA SHOULD BE ON A LIST FOR CHINA MILITARY TIES
BITCOIN $BTC JUST BROKE ABOVE $90K

This is why the AI cycle is nothing like the dot-com era.

Early-2000s fiber ran at roughly 7% utilization because the industry built far ahead of demand that never showed up. The physical layer scaled faster than the software.

Today is the inverse. $NVDA clusters inside $MSFT, $AMZN, $GOOGL and $META are running ~80% utilization because every model lab is capacity-constrained. The software layer is scaling far faster than the physical.

One cycle had excess supply and no demand. This one has excess demand and not nearly enough supply. That‚Äôs the entire difference.

$NVDA

I laugh when people call $AMZN overvalued.

It runs the most advanced logistics network in the world, owns the strongest point-of-purchase ad business in the consumer economy & AWS now generates more profit than the entire retail arm.

And it still trades cheaper than $WMT & $COST.

Why is $ORCL down 30% in the past month? 

Because Oracle is taking on the most aggressive capex plan in the industry & funding a data center buildout that is outsized relative to its revenue base.

When you tie ~$500B of future obligations to one counterparty in OpenAI then the market starts assigning a Sam Altman risk premium.

The upside is very real if demand holds & if Oracle can deploy capacity faster than $AMZN, $MSFT or $GOOGL but the balance-sheet and concentration risks are just as real.

I think the payoff will be enormous.

This chart shows the real state of AI.

‚Ä¢ Capex is tracking toward $600B 2028 which means $AMZN, $MSFT, $GOOGL, $META & $ORCL are now building some of the largest industrial projects ever attempted.
‚Ä¢ The real constraint is shifting from GPU supply to power + land because every new model cycle adds another wave of megawatt demand.
‚Ä¢ This spending will not normalize since a multi-gigawatt footprint needs to be refreshed every 3-4 years.

Whoever secures power and land & can stand up capacity the fastest will end up owning the AI economy of the next decade.

$GOOGL is basically saying the long-term bottleneck for AI is power. 

If TPUs can operate in space where solar is 8x stronger then power stops being the constraint & the cost curve for compute opens up in a meaningful way.

The Nov Chicago Business Barometer (formerly ISM) was released y'day. It collapsed.

Something similar happened in Dec 2024, and I suggested that it was not a signal of a national downturn, but was the Chicago-area Purchasing Manager "sending a hostage note pleading for help."

Same here, consider (all in the last month):

* Property taxes assessments were mailed in November, and they soared as much as 100% in some neighborhoods.
* Illinois now  has the highest property taxes in the country
*  The Mayor wants to raise taxes on businesses.
* The Governor wants to raise the state income tax
* Several people are shot at a Christmas Tree lighting
* An entire class of 10-year-olds beat up a pregnant mother and her physically challenged son.
* A woman was doused with gasoline and set on fire on Public Transportation
* Every Monday comes with the weekend tally of crime and carnage.
* The Government and Mayor dismiss the violence as an "isolated incident" and refuse any help to get crime under control.

Frankly, I'm surprised the purchasing managers are this optimistic.

@marcuslemonis @GovPritzker @ChicagosMayor

Among the hyperscalers with links to OpenAI, Oracle $ORCL has the highest concentration to the company, with OpenAI accounting for ~58% of its backlog, versus 39% for Microsoft $MSFT and 16% for Amazon $AMZN, per Jefferies.
The Mag 7 combined account for almost 35% of the S&P 500, with Nvidia $NVDA, Apple $AAPL and Microsoft $MSFT alone accounting for more than one-fifth of the index with a combined weighting of 19.7%.
